results.title: Duke of Wellington
results.creator_credit: Frank Stevens, Clifford Parris and Film House Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “London No 1”.
A visit to Apsley House at Hyde Park Corner in London which belonged to the first Duke of Wellington and houses the Wellington Museum. It is known popularly as No. 1, London.

results.title: Nitrous oxide, oxygen, ether, anaesthesia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Technique of anaesthesia”.
This film shows the working of a typical apparatus designed to deliver a continuous flow on nitrous oxide to the patient. Ether in varied quantities can be added to the mixture of gases as required. One animated diagram sequence in the film deals with the way in which the machine works; another deals with the principle of re-breathing. Induction and maintenance of anaesthesia are demonstrated with emphasis rather on the use of the machine than on general principles.

results.title: Nikkolina
results.creator_credit: Glen Salzman, Rebecca Yates, Cineflics and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Deals with the conflict of one’s own personal goals and one’s family by presenting a story about an American-born girl in a Greek immigrant family, and her resolution of the conflict between a skating event and a family wedding.

results.title: Newfoundland scene: a tale of outport adventure (D)
results.brief_description: NB: CONTAINS DISTURBING SCENES OF THE SLAUGHTER OF BABY SEALS. A study of Newfoundland’s natural resources and primary industry. Cod fishing, sealing and whaling are the focus of this documentary. Also looked at is transportation by Eskimo sled. Includes scenes of Labrador Retrievers, a malemute dog sled team mutinying against its leader causing injfires, the light from a lighthouse and a Newfoundland outport wharf in the misty dawn. (Awards: Canadian Film Award, 1951)

results.title: New ways in farming
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
Illustrates modern trends in agriculture such as large-scale factory-style farming, with crops scientifically scheduled and cultivated. Discusses the farm co-operative; and shows how the traditionally independent farmer with the aid of new mechanised farm equipment, is able to make his farm an increasingly prosperous business.

results.title: New voices
results.creator_credit: James Beveridge and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Crossroads of the world: a study of North Africa and the Middle East”.
In a world where the fortunes of one people crisscross with others, it is to be expected that the voices of Muslim countries will be raised on world issues. At the United Nations and other international gatherings, this film watches and listens to the new leaders of the Islamic world. What you see and hear has much meaning for you, and even more significance for the new African nations among whom Islam is a live and growing force.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Beveridge and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: New uses for Seaweed
results.brief_description: A brief account of the uses to which alginates, which are obtained from seaweed, are being put - from foodstuffs to toothpaste. A fine synthetic fibre, spun from the jelly is used in the manufacture of light-weight woollen materials.

results.title: A New supervisor takes a look at his job
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Problems in Supervision”.
A young worker has just been made a line supervisor; in an interview with the superintendent, he is told that in his new job he must learn to get results by working with people instead of with machines.
